text: After these things Joseph was told, “Your father is weakening.” So he took his two sons Manasseh and Ephraim with him.

When <st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> was <st data-num="05046 0559">told</st>,<n id="1" /> “Your <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st> has <st data-num="02009" class="">just</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you,” <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="02388" class="">regained strength</st> and <st data-num="03427" class="">sat up</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> his <st data-num="04296" class="">bed</st>.

<st data-num="03290" class="">Jacob</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st>, “The <st data-num="07706" class="">Sovereign</st> <st data-num="0410" class="">God</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="07200" class="">appeared</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me at <st data-num="03870" class="">Luz</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of <st data-num="03667" class="">Canaan</st> and <st data-num="01288" class="">blessed</st> me.
He said to me, ‘I am going to make you fruitful and will multiply you. I will make you into a group of nations, and I will give this land to your descendants as an everlasting possession.’
“Now, as for your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you in Egypt, they will be mine. Ephraim and Manasseh will be mine just as Reuben and Simeon are.

Any <st data-num="04138" class="">children</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> you <st data-num="03205" class="">father</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0310" class="">after</st> them will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> yours; they will be <st data-num="07121" class="">listed</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">under</st> the <st data-num="08034" class="">names</st> of their <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st> in their <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st>.<n id="3" />

But as for me, when I was returning from Paddan, Rachel died—to my sorrow—in the land of Canaan. It happened along the way, some distance from Ephrath. So I buried her there on the way to Ephrath” (that is, Bethlehem).
When Israel saw Joseph’s sons, he asked, “Who are these?”

<st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="01" class="">father</st>, “They <st data-num="01992" class="">are</st> the<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01121 0834">sons</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> has <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> me in <st data-num="02088" class="">this place</st>.” His father<n id="2" /> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="03947 04994">Bring</st> them <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me so I may <st data-num="01288" class="">bless</st> them.”<n id="3" />

Now <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel’s</st> <st data-num="05869" class="">eyes</st> were <st data-num="03513" class="">failing</st><n id="1" /> because of his <st data-num="02207" class="">age</st>; he <st data-num="03201" class="">was</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03201" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="07200" class="">see</st> well. So Joseph<n id="2" /> <st data-num="05066" class="">brought</st> his sons<n id="3" /> <st data-num="05066" class="">near</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, and his father<n id="4" /> <st data-num="05401" class="">kissed</st> them and <st data-num="02263" class="">embraced</st> them.
Israel said to Joseph, “I never expected to see you again, but now God has allowed me to see your children too.”
So Joseph moved them from Israel’s knees and bowed down with his face to the ground.

<st data-num="03130" class="">Joseph</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">positioned</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">them</st>;<n id="1" /> he put <st data-num="0669" class="">Ephraim</st> on his <st data-num="03225" class="">right hand</st> across from <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel’s</st> <st data-num="08040" class="">left hand</st>, and <st data-num="04519" class="">Manasseh</st> on his <st data-num="08040" class="">left hand</st> across from <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel’s</st> <st data-num="03225" class="">right hand</st>. Then Joseph <st data-num="05066" class="">brought</st> them <st data-num="05066" class="">closer</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his father.<n id="2" />
Israel stretched out his right hand and placed it on Ephraim’s head, although he was the younger. Crossing his hands, he put his left hand on Manasseh’s head, for Manasseh was the firstborn.

Then he blessed Joseph and said,

“May the God before whom my fathers

Abraham and Isaac walked—

the God who has been my shepherd

all my life long to this day,

the angel who has protected me

from all harm—

bless these boys.

May my name be named in them,

and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac.

May they grow into a multitude on the earth.”
When Joseph saw that his father placed his right hand on Ephraim’s head, it displeased him. So he took his father’s hand to move it from Ephraim’s head to Manasseh’s head.
Joseph said to his father, “Not so, my father, for this is the firstborn. Put your right hand on his head.”

But his father refused and said, “I know, my son, I know. He too will become a nation and he too will become great. In spite of this, his younger brother will be even greater and his descendants will become a multitude of nations.”

So he blessed them that day, saying,

“By you will Israel bless, saying,

‘May God make you like Ephraim and Manasseh.’”

Thus he put Ephraim before Manasseh.
Then Israel said to Joseph, “I am about to die, but God will be with you and will bring you back to the land of your fathers.
As one who is above your brothers, I give to you the mountain slope, which I took from the Amorites with my sword and my bow.”
